question.question-text: The author begins the first paragraph with One more familiar use of electrochemistry in order to

answer-list.answer-text: explain that xerography is one of the less familiar uses of electrochemistry
make it clear that electrochemistry requires photoconductive materials
show that xerography is the only known use for electrochemistry
indicate that other less familiar uses have already been discussed

question.question-text: Why does the author explain that A photoconductive material is an insulator in the dark but becomes a conductor when exposed to bright light?

answer-list.answer-text: It gives an explanation of a property that is necessary for xerography.
It indicates that bright light is required for insulation to take place.
It gives one example of a successful xerographic process.
It explains the role of insulation in xerography.

question.question-text: The author places the phrase small grains to which dry ink adheres in parentheses in order to

answer-list.answer-text: provide information that contradicts the previous statement
provide another example of conductivity
provide further detail information about toner
provide an alternate explanation for the effectiveness of toner

question.question-text: Why is a laser printer mentioned?

answer-list.answer-text: It is an alternative to xerography.
It is a way of duplicating without using electrochemistry.
It is a second example of xerography.
It is a less effective type of xerography than is a photocopier.

question.question-text: The author mentions a Pittsburgh department store in paragraph 5 in order to show that the development of commercial radio broadcasting was enabled because broadcasting

answer-list.answer-text: could take place in department stores
required receivers to be installed at stores
offered opportunities to other commercial ventures
could be promoted during sales at stores
